pageContext.claim: “No [I am not worried about Russians meddling in the midterms], because we’ll counteract whatever they do.  We’ll counteract it very strongly. And we are having strong backup systems...And we’ve been working, actually — we haven’t been given credit for this, but we’ve actually been working very hard on the ’18 election and the ’20 election coming up.”
pageContext.analysis: The president appears to be overstating his hand. The nation's top intelligence chiefs told Congress in February that "there should be no doubt that Russia perceives its past efforts [in the 2016 election] as successful and views the 2018 midterm elections as a potential target for Russian influence operations." Although they confirmed that the respective agencies were working to thwart this, Director of National Intelligence Daniel Coats said there was "no single agency in charge" and FBI Director Christopher A. Wray said the bureau was undertaking many "specific activities" but noted they weren't at the president's direction.
